snippet: Apple is in the early stages of negotiating with the major record labels for a service that would send streams of music customized to users’ tastes.
abstract: Apple is in the early stages of negotiating with the major record labels for a service that would send streams of music customized to users’ tastes; service would compete with Pandora Media in a move that could shake up the growing field of Internet radio.

headline.main: Apple Plans Web Radio Challenge to Pandora
headline.print_headline: Apple Plans Web Radio Challenge To Pandora

byline.original: By BEN SISARIO and NICK WINGFIELD

snippet: Jeff Bezos, Amazon's chief executive, believes that black-and-white e-readers will always have a home in the e-reader family. The new Kindle Paperwhite is the latest evidence of this belief.
abstract: Jeff Bezos, Amazon's chief executive, believes that black-and-white e-readers will always have a home in the e-reader family. The new Kindle Paperwhite is the latest evidence of this belief.

headline.main: Black and White Kindles Are Here to Stay

snippet: Our quirky, discerning picks for the most interesting things to do around the state this week.

The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Thursday's selection includes Vanity Fair anointing a collection of technology executives as "The New Establishment," the prospect of mobile...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Thursday's selection includes Vanity Fair anointing a collection of technology executives as "The New Establishment," the prospect of mobile apps for 4Chan and an 84-second video that claims to show an iPhone 5 starting up.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot:  iPhone 5 Video and Apple TV Delay

snippet: Revivals of “Glengarry Glen Ross,” “Who’s Afraid of Virginia Woolf?” and “Annie” are coming to Broadway this fall, as Off Broadway greets New York premieres like the acclaimed “Detroit.”

headline.main: ‘Annie’ for Sun, a New ‘Woolf’ for Fear

snippet: With a new version of the Kindle Fire nearly as large as the iPad that undercuts its price by $200, Amazon made its challenge to Apple a little more serious.
abstract: Amazon, in a challenge to Apple's iPad, announces updates to its line of Kindle e-readers and tablets, including a new version of the Kindle Fire HD nearly as large as the iPad that undercuts its price by $200; company now has seven models ranging from a basic $70 black-and-white screen e-reader to a $600 color tablet.

headline.main: Amazon Updates Its Kindle Line of E-Readers
headline.print_headline: Amazon Unveils New Round of Kindles

snippet: A settlement with three major publishers in an antitrust case brought by the government paves the way for a war over the cost of digital books.
abstract: A settlement with three major publishers in an antitrust case brought by the government paves the way for a war over the cost of digital books.

headline.main: Judge Approves E-Book Pricing Settlement Between Government and Publishers
headline.print_headline: Judge Approves E-Book Pricing Settlement Between Government and Publishers

snippet: The company showed off the Kindle Paperwhite with a new whiter screen, and a new Kindle Fire HD that is a more direct competitor to the iPad than the old Kindle Fire.
abstract: The company showed off the Kindle Paperwhite with a new whiter screen, and a new Kindle Fire HD that is a more direct competitor to the iPad than the old Kindle Fire.

headline.main: Live Updates From Amazon's Press Event

snippet: Pizza Brain, a pizza parlor that is home to the world's largest collection of pizza memorabilia, opens Friday in Philadelphia.
abstract: Pizza Brain, a pizza parlor that is home to the world's largest collection of pizza memorabilia, opens Friday in Philadelphia.

headline.main: World's First Pizza Museum Opening in Philadelphia

snippet: Also, hackers briefly take over Al Jazeera's Arabic and English Web sites.
abstract: Also, hackers briefly take over Al Jazeera's Arabic and English Web sites.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Bill Clinton Grabs Spotlight, and New Tablets and Phones
